comment: Options and answers are numbered starting from 0

question: Given
10. class Foo {
11. static void alpha() { /* more code here */ }
12. void beta() { /* more code here */ }
Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)
options: Foo.beta() is a valid invocation of beta().
Foo.alpha() is a valid invocation of alpha().
Method beta() can directly call method alpha().
Method beta() can directly call method alpha().
